title: Meiji Restoration
key_facts: Restored imperial rule under Emperor Meiji in 1868
Abolished feudal domains and centralized administration
Rapid modernization in industry, military, and education
causes: Weakening of the Tokugawa shogunate and internal unrest
Pressure from Western powers and unequal treaties
Reform movements seeking to strengthen and modernize Japan
outcome: Charter Oath established principles for modernization
Meiji Constitution (1889) created a constitutional monarchy
Conscription, land tax reform, and compulsory education instituted

figures.name: Ito Hirobumi
figures.role: Statesman and architect of the Meiji Constitution

figures.name: Saigo Takamori
figures.role: Key leader in the Restoration; later led the Satsuma Rebellion

figures.name: Okubo Toshimichi
figures.role: Influential reformer in government and industry

impacts: Transformed Japan into a modern industrial power
Reconfigured social classes and governance structures
Set the stage for Japan's emergence as a regional military power
